messages: 1f58faf0d058f303f30239a369808167 (14:03): edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e: you can remove the slash, oversight from me. Imagine that corp.invalid becomes a real domain name. example.org|net|com are reserved for examples in specs
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (14:04): .invalid is reserved
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (14:04): that's why I used it
1f58faf0d058f303f30239a369808167 (14:08): oooooh my bad then. Gomenasai
1f58faf0d058f303f30239a369808167 (14:08): http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Top-level_domain#Reserved_domains
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (14:12): http://blog.whatwg.org/weekly-simple-dom
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (14:12): oh, Florian just left!
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (14:30): edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e: so is there a reason the event handlers can't just be mixed with the attributes?
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (14:30): they'll prolly merge
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (14:31): ['div', {onclick:func, class:'foo'}, 'hello']
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (14:32): i guess one problem with this is that svg and mathml are not supported
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (14:32): cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0: It makes a bit of a confusing model if the type affects how the  property is set
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (14:32): we can just check the property
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (14:32): Because ut should set attributes not properties in other cases
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (14:33): starts with "on", please go over there...
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (14:33): b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea: i was thinking of looking at the attribute name, not the value type
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (14:33): http://html5.org/specs/dom-range.html
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (14:33): Great, as only as there are no attributes called "only" or similar
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (14:34): Which seems like a scary thing to assume
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (14:34): i was thinking of using the list of supported event handles
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (14:35): b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea, seems like a silly attribute to introduce
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (14:35): cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0, yeah, you would have to do that anyway
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (14:35): so what do we do with svg and mathml?

b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (14:36): edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e: Magic prefix matching with no clear prefix delimiter seems bad compared to haven hidden rules about the avaliable namespace for new attributes
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (14:37): Umm, that made no sense
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (14:37): seems bad *because* it introduces hidden rules
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (14:37): cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0, "svg:svg" and "math:mtext" or some such
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (14:38): there are hidden rules in attribute naming already
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (14:38): cannot start a non-event handler with on
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (14:39): edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e: is the verbosity for svg acceptable to svg people?
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (14:39): verbosity?
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (14:39): come on
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (14:41): it's more verbose compared to html
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (14:41): but maybe it's ok
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (14:42): would it create elements with prefixes or without?
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (14:42): Adding a scoping attribute, like [{'ns': 'svg'}, 'svg', ['circle', ...], ...]
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (14:43): wonders if that is a serious suggestion
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (14:43): Sometimes it is hard to tell :)
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (14:44): It's better than ['svg', {'xmlns':'http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'}, ['circle', ...], ...] at least :-p
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (14:44): (which was going to be my initial suggestion)
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (14:45): 'svg:svg' seems better, especially if you're going to mix html and svg
cd13b3e4f560b1d7df8e639c87bf0623 (14:46): edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e THANKs!
